skill.name: developer-experience
skill.description: Developer Experience specialist for tooling, setup, and workflow optimization. Use when setting up projects, reducing friction, improving development workflows, or automating repetitive tasks. Focuses on making development joyful and productive.
skill.summary: Developer Experience specialist for tooling, setup, and workflow optimization. Use when setting up p...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and example templates for developer experience optimization. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Developer experience friction slows down teams and frustrates new contributors. This skill analyzes workflows and creates automation scripts, tooling configurations, and documentation to make development faster, clearer, and more enjoyable.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes existing development workflows and identifies friction points
Creates setup scripts for project onboarding under 5 minutes
Configures IDE settings, ESLint, Prettier, and VS Code settings
Sets up git hooks for pre-commit linting and testing
Generates npm scripts, Makefiles, and shell aliases for common tasks
Creates developer onboarding guides and troubleshooting documentation
limitations: Cannot execute generated scripts - users must run them manually
Cannot modify files on the filesystem directly
Cannot access project-specific secrets or credentials
Depends on the AI tool having access to the project codebase

use_cases.title: Standardize project setup
use_cases.description: Create consistent onboarding scripts and tooling configurations across all team projects.

use_cases.title: Faster onboarding
use_cases.description: Set up development environment and understand project structure in less time.

use_cases.title: Automate repetitive tasks
use_cases.description: Generate automation scripts for builds, tests, deployments, and database operations.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current development workflow in this project and identify repetitive tasks, bottlenecks, and opportunities for automation.

prompt_templates.title: Create setup script
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a setup.sh script that automates environment setup including dependency installation, environment validation, and database migrations.

prompt_templates.title: Configure git hooks
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up git pre-commit hooks using husky that run linting and tests before commits are accepted.

prompt_templates.title: Generate npm scripts
prompt_templates.prompt: Add helpful npm scripts to package.json for development, testing, linting, formatting, and database operations.

output_examples.input: Set up this project for optimal developer experience
output: **Git Hooks**: Pre-commit linting and test quality gates
**NPM Scripts**: Standardized commands for dev, test, lint, format
**VS Code Settings**: EditorConfig, ESLint, and debugging configurations

best_practices: Keep setup scripts idempotent so they can be run multiple times safely
Include clear error messages that guide users toward resolution
Validate dependencies before attempting installation to fail fast
anti_patterns: Skipping dependency version checks that lead to cryptic runtime errors
Missing validation steps that cause setup to fail silently
Creating scripts without documentation on what each command does

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works in any conversational AI environment.

faq.question: What types of automation can this skill create?
faq.answer: Setup scripts, npm/yarn scripts, Makefiles, shell aliases, git hooks, and IDE configurations.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates suggestions and code examples. Users must manually apply changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution or network access. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if generated scripts do not work?
faq.answer: Review the script output for error messages. The skill creates clear documentation and troubleshooting steps.

faq.question: How is this different from DevOps tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on local developer experience. DevOps tools handle deployment and infrastructure. Both can work together.
